definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Ordinary Tunisians kept their heads down and attended to their work.
sentences.chinese: 普通的突尼斯人埋起頭來，默不作聲，只專注於工作。

sentences.english: They now walked on in silence; each of them deep in thought.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆默不作聲地往前走，各人在想各人的心思。

sentences.english: Gabriel looked hopelessly away and did not reply.
sentences.chinese: 蓋伯瑞爾失望地把目光移開，默不作聲。

sentences.english: Natasha sat the whole time without speaking, looking up from under her brows at him.
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎始終默不作聲地坐着，皺起眉頭望着他。

sentences.english: Then once more taking his hand, he walked on with him in silence.
sentences.chinese: 他又一次拉起奧立弗的手，默不作聲地繼續往前走去。

sentences.english: He was standing there by night like one intent on doing evil.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜默不作聲站在那裏，好像是來幹壞事的。

sentences.english: Morel subdued, afraid to seem too jubilant in presence of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 毛萊爾默不作聲，唯恐在妻子面前過於喜形於色。

sentences.english: Through this ordeal Heng lay stiff and silent.
sentences.chinese: 在這個嚴酷的考驗中，恆一直僵硬地躺着，默不作聲。

sentences.english: She passed by the remark in silence.
sentences.chinese: 她默不作聲沒理會這句話。

sentences.english: They all kept silence and burdened their luggage stepping upstairs without any murmur.
sentences.chinese: 並無任何怨言，只是默不作聲地揹着行李上樓。

sentences.english: Sara did not answer when Lavinia said these things.
sentences.chinese: 拉維尼婭這麼說的時候，薩拉默不作聲。

sentences.english: Jennie fell to her task in silence.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮默不作聲地開始了她的工作。

sentences.english: "Pe-eek! "It was a cry of joyful discovery, but it was followed almost immediately by silence.
sentences.chinese: “匹克”她高興地喊了一聲，但隨後又默不作聲了。

sentences.english: Scarlett was silent and her heart sank.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉默不作聲，她的心在往下沉。

sentences.english: She fell silent at the key moment, thus the talk broke down half way.
sentences.chinese: 在關鍵時刻她突然變得默不作聲，這讓和談半途而費。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
